title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - REVISION
description: Reviewed and updated the project requirements. The project will focus on developing quantum algorithms for cryptography and drug discovery applications using quantum computing simulators. Specific algorithms include Shor's algorithm, Grover's algorithm, Quantum Monte Carlo (QMC) methods, and variational quantum eigensolver (VQE). Performance goals have been established, and constraints, assumptions, and relevant industry standards have been identified. A list of target applications is included.

title: Design System Architecture - RFC Review
description: Design the overall system architecture for QuantumAlgorithmForge project. This includes selection of quantum computing simulator(s), choice of programming languages (Python and Qiskit are recommended due to their wide adoption in the quantum computing community), integration with external libraries or tools (such as Pennylane, Cerberus, and QWorld), defining development, testing, and deployment workflows (using GitHub for version control and continuous integration/continuous delivery via CircleCI).

title: Develop Quantum Algorithms
description: Implement the quantum algorithms for the specified applications, following the defined system architecture and best practices for quantum programming.

title: Set up Testing and Validation Framework (Revised)
description: Create a comprehensive testing and validation framework that ensures the correctness, performance, and scalability of developed quantum algorithms. The framework will encompass unit tests, integration tests, benchmarking tools, and automated test suites for continuous integration and regression testing. Additionally, include self-healing capabilities to automatically recover from test failures in a timely manner.

title: Implement Quantum-Resistant Security Measures
description: Integrate quantum-resistant security measures to protect the quantum algorithms and the underlying system, addressing potential quantum computing threats and vulnerabilities such as quantum attacks on classical cryptography, side-channel attacks, and weaknesses in quantum error correction codes. Also consider the future-proofing aspects, preparing for post-quantum cryptographic standards.

title: Develop Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for the developed quantum algorithms, covering installation, usage, and troubleshooting.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD) - Revised
description: Revise the existing description for clarity and comprehensiveness. Establish a continuous integration and deployment pipeline to automate the build, testing, and deployment processes for the quantum algorithms and related components. The pipeline should include steps for code linting, static analysis, unit testing, integration testing, and deployment to staging and production environments. Ensure that the pipeline is configurable, maintainable, scalable, secure, and efficient to accommodate future growth and changes. Involve relevant team members in the CI/CD process, such as developers, QA testers, security specialists, devops engineers, and technical writers. Collaborate with assigned developer to integrate the pipeline into the existing project workflow. Regularly review and update the pipeline to ensure its effectiveness.
dependencies: Set up Testing and Validation Framework
